learning_goal: Understand how recommendation systems use attribute similarity, user interaction feedback, and profile evolution

environment.description: A sunny garden with stylized data plants and a sprinkler-equipped gardener

mappings.analogy_description: The user embodies a gardener with a handheld sprinkler tool and a backpack tank
mappings.trellis_prompt: cartoon gardener character with watering can

mappings.analogy_description: Stylized futuristic plant models that progress through life stages (seed, sprout, bloom, wilt)
A gauge on the user's wrist with a visible fluid level and color that changes based on watered plants
A targeted water stream from the sprinkler aimed at a specific plant

interaction.effect_description: A continuous water stream flows from the sprinkler toward the targeted plant

mappings.analogy_description: The fluid in the Profile Tank changes color to a weighted average of watered plant colors

interaction.effect_description: The gauge fluid color shifts toward the weighted average of recently watered plant colors

mappings.analogy_description: The water stream has a maximum effective distance; only plants within range can be interacted with

interaction.effect_description: Only plants within the water stream effective range are candidates for interaction

mappings.analogy_description: Plants with color most similar to the Profile Tank grow faster, representing attribute-based ranking

interaction.effect_description: Plants whose color most closely matches the gauge fluid grow faster and larger, visualizing attribute similarity ranking

mappings.analogy_description: Watering plants of a certain color changes the tank, accelerating growth of similar-color plants

interaction.effect_description: Watering plants changes the gauge color (profile_update), which accelerates growth of color-similar plants (ranking), which makes them more prominent within range (candidate_generation), reinforcing the watering preference
